item.title: Inti Creates announces Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Action and strategy hybrid due out on April 23, 2026.

Inti Creates has announced hybrid 2D action and strategy game Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC (Steam). It will launch on April 23, 2026 for $14.99 / 1,980 yen worldwide. Users who buy the Switch version will be able to upgrade to the Switch 2 version via a free “Upgrade Pack.”

In Japan, physical standard and limited editions will be available for PlayStation 5 and Switch. The standard edition will cost 3,850 yen, and the limited edition 9,350 yen. The limited edition includes a full-color art book, a two-disc soundtrack CD, and an acrylic keychain. All physical editions will also include the bonus downloadable content “Gunvolt Character Skin,” and pre-orders include an A4-size original clear file.

Here is an overview of the game, via Inti Creates:

■ About

Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster is an action RPG where players must adventure to restore their fallen kingdom. Collect materials in 2D side-scrolling adventure stages, then use them in the strategy part to build your city as you see fit, and powering up your characters in the process!

hoose from one of four characters, Imperial, Alchemist, Wizard, or Zipangu, and set out on adventure through a variety of action stages. Collect the materials here you’ll use to build up your kingdom, placing buildings that buff your characters’ stats. Then set out again to conquer even more dangerous stages, until the bosses are afraid of you!

■ Story

In a world of swords, magic, and fairies, you are a lone adventurer who suddenly becomes tasked to revive the ruined kingdom of Almacia along with the Fairy of Time, Chronos.

Through adventure (action) and revival (strategy), restore the kingdom to its former glory!

■ Playable Characters

Imperial

With high defense, Imperial is your reliable close-range fighter.

Her shield gives her guard abilities that allow her to safely get into range for her sword. Her easy-to-use skills, together with her unique counter action, give her a high maximum damage output.

Alchemist

Alchemist specializes in mixing potions to inflict statuses and other effects on enemies. Change the element of his bottles with a unique action, then inflict the perfect status effect for the situation.

His skills also apply a variety of debuffs, allowing him to consistently weaken his enemies.

Conversely, he has few direct attacks, so he’ll need to focus on status effects while he fights.

Wizard

Wizard fights from long range using a variety of magic attacks.

Her charge action can power up her magic before she casts it. Most of her actions will use SP (skill points), so you’ll need to keep an eye on it.

Her health and defense is low, so positioning is of utmost importance.

Zipangu

Skilled at attacking and dodging, Zipangu’s specialty is consecutive attacks.

He can get in close with a dodge move, then press the attack harder than any other character.

What he wants to do is rather simple: dodge, then attack back. However, his defense is lacking, so failing to dodge will be painful.

item.title: Call of Duty Will No Longer Do Back-to-back Releases of Modern Warfare or Black Ops Games
item.content:encoded:
The team promises "an absolutely unique experience each and every year."

Call of Duty will no longer release multiple Black Ops or Modern Warfare games back-to-back, after two Modern Warfare releases in 2022 and 2023, and two Black Ops releases in 2024 and 2025, respectively, and negative feedback and concerning sales reports for the most recent release, Black Ops 7.

This news was delivered from "the Call of Duty team" (encompassing studios Treyarch, Sledgehammer, Infinity Ward, and Raven Software) on the official website, in a post that acknowledged the criticism of Black Ops 7 as well as broader criticism of the franchise in recent years. As the post opens:

First off, thank you for all for the feedback we have received over the last few months. Call of Duty has enjoyed long-standing success because of all of you, a passionate community that demands excellence and deserves nothing less. We also know that for some of you, the Franchise has not met your expectations fully. To be very clear, we know what you expect and rest assured we will deliver, and overdeliver, on those expectations as we move forward.

The post goes on to state a number of changes the Call of Duty studios will be making going forward. For starters, they're opening up Black Ops 7's multiplayer zombies mode for a free trial and Double XP weekend next week, in an effort to get those who have hesitated on Black Ops 7 to "experience the game firsthand and decide for yourselves." They also are committing to "unprecedented season support," saying that they "won't rest until Black Ops 7 earns its place as one of the best Black Ops games we’ve ever made."

Then, the team had this to say about future Call of Duty releases:

We will no longer do back-to-back releases of Modern Warfare or Black Ops games. The reasons are many, but the main one is to ensure we provide an absolutely unique experience each and every year.
We will drive innovation that is meaningful, not incremental. While we aren’t sharing those plans today, we look forward to doing so when the time is right.

The note concludes by saying the team believes Call of Duty's "best days are ahead of us" and that the next era of Call of Duty will "deliver precisely on what you want along with some surprises that push the Franchise and the genre forward."

These changes come amidst, and likely in response to, a rough couple of years for the Call of Duty franchise. The most recent entry, Black Ops 7, debuted last month to middling reviews, including our own 6/10 campaign review, 6/10 Zombies review, and significantly better 8/10 multiplayer review. This is also in the context of both Black Ops 7 and Modern Warfare 3 receiving poor reviews in comparison to their immediate series predecessors the year before, with Black Ops 6 and Modern Warfare 2 being received generally favorably. This likely accounts, at least in part, for the decision to stop the back-to-back releases.

For Black Ops 7, that lukewarm reception has also been reflected in the game's sales numbers, especially in relation to another recent major multiplayer shooter release, Battlefield 6. The game had a "terrible" launch in Europe, down 63% versus Battlefield 6 and down by more than 50% versus last year's Black Ops 6 in the equivalent periods.

It is worth noting that we don't have full visibility into Black Ops 7's sales data, as it launched day one on Game Pass, and a number of people likely played the game through the subscription service and didn't count as unit sales.

But nonetheless, the announcement today feels like an admission that something has gone wrong here. Whether or not the Call of Duty team can fix it will take a few years to truly comprehend.

Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com.

item.title: Gibson SG Wireless Guitar Controller For PS5 Launches This Month
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon has opened preorders for CRKD's next Gibson Guitar Controller. The Gibson SG 20th Anniversary Edition retails for $135 and is slated to launch December 19. Notably, this is the first wireless guitar controller in CRKD's catalog licensed by PlayStation. The Gibson SG syncs wirelessly to PS5, PS4, PS3, and PC via a 2.4GHz dongle. The multiplatform version of CRKD's Gibson Les Paul Guitar Controller is limited to a wired connection on PS5 and PS4, so the Gibson SG is likely the better option for Fortnite Festival and Rock Band 4 players on PlayStation.

PS5 players now have two officially licensed wireless guitar controllers to choose from. The other is the PDP Riffmaster, which is still on sale for its $110 (was $150) Black Friday price.

CRKD Gibson SG Wireless Guitar Controller (PS5, PS4, PC)

$135 | Releases December 19

The real Gibson SG has been around since 1961; the 20th Anniversary Edition moniker is a reference to the original controller bundled with Guitar Hero for PS5 in 2005. The original Gibson SG had a red body and black pick guard, whereas the new model has a black body, white pick guard, and brown neck. Still, it's rather fitting that the first officially licensed Gibson controller for PS5 pays homage to the most recognizable guitar in Guitar Hero history.

The 20th Anniversary Edition has Matte EZ Glide Mechanical Frets with RGB backlighting, a Hall Effect strum bar with the classic "clicking" feedback, a whammy bar, and a tilt sensor to activate Star Power. Like the Les Paul editions, the SG has a modular design with a removable neck. The controller's D-pad is located on the back of the headstock. The eight-button Navigation Hub has PlayStation input labels and a Hall Effect stick in the center. The dial with the PlayStation logo switches between wireless and wired connections, while the white dial lets you activate KEYJAM and Legacy modes. Legacy mode lets you use the controller wirelessly on PS3 to play old Rock Band and Guitar Hero games.

According to CRKD's compatibility list, KEYJAM mode on the SG is different from the Les Paul. It's likely due to the PlayStation license, but KEYJAM seems to only work for PlayStation consoles and PC. The Les Paul multiplatform guitars can play Fortnite Festival in wired mode on PlayStation and Xbox consoles in KEYJAM mode. It's also worth noting the Les Paul multiplatform editions support Switch 1/2 with wireless and wired connections and have Legacy mode for PS3. Both models support Bluetooth connections for mobile devices and are compatible with CRKD's free customization app.

Here's what you'll find inside the box:

  • Black SG Guitar Controller Body
  • Brown OG Signature Pro Fret Neck
  • Black Shoulder Strap
  • 2.4GHz Wireless Dongle
  • 8.2-foot USB-C Cable
  • Removable Rechargeable Battery
  • KEYJAM Nav Hub Sticker
  • Quickstart Guide

All CRKD Gibson Guitar Controllers

The Gibson SG's $135 price point matches the Les Paul Blueberry Burst Pro that's officially licensed by Microsoft for Xbox consoles. The Black Tribal Encore Edition is $125 for Xbox and has membrane fret buttons instead of mechanical switches. The multiplatform versions of the Les Paul are $10 cheaper than the Xbox models. It's worth noting that the Blueberry Burst Pro Editions have strum bars with haptic feedback. Last month, CRKD released a Les Paul Cherry Sunburst Pro Collector's Bundle for $200. This multiplatform model comes with a guitar backpack, a leather strap, pins, and stickers.

The Gibson SG has confirmed wireless and wired compatibility with Fortnite Festival and Rock Band 4 on PS5 and PS4. It also works wirelessly on PC with Fortnite Festival, Clone Hero, YARG, and Guitar Hero III. Legacy Mode for PS3 supports all of the platform's Guitar Hero and Rock Band games as well as Band Hero.

We've listed all of CRKD's Gibson Guitar Controllers below along with platform compatibility for each edition.

Gibson SG for PlayStation:

  • Gibson SG 20th Anniversary Edition -- $135 | December 19
  • Wireless: PS5, PS4, PC, Android, Apple, PS3
  • KEYJAM Wired Mode: Fortnite Festival (PS5, PS4, PC), YARG (PC), Clone Hero (PC)

Gibson Les Paul Multiplatform:

  • Blueberry Burst Pro Edition -- $125
  • Black Tribal Encore Edition -- $115
  • Cherry Sunburst Collector's Bundle -- $200
  • Wireless: PC, Switch 1/2, Android, Apple, PS3
  • KEYJAM Wired Mode: Fortnite Festival on PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC

Gibson Les Paul for Xbox:

  • Blueberry Burst Pro Edition -- $135
  • Black Tribal Encore Edition -- $125
  • Wireless: Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, Apple, Android

As mentioned, the PDP Riffmaster for PS5 and PS4 is discounted to $110 (was $150) at Amazon. The officially licensed Xbox edition is also on sale for $109. PDP launched a Nintendo Switch 1/2 version of the Riffmaster last month, but it's currently selling for its full $150 MSRP.

item.title: SHADE Protocol Kickstarter campaign launches in spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Latest look at the 2D cyber-fantasy Metroidvania game.

Little Legendary will launch a Kickstarter campaign for side-scrolling cyber-fantasy Metroidvania game SHADE Protocol in spring 2026, the developer announced.

The crowdfunding campaign will focus on raising funds for console ports, speeding up development time, additional content, hiring guest composers from known titles, and more.

“Since revealing SHADE Protocol a few months ago, the game has become one of the most wishlisted games in the world, showing us that we have something special in our hands and that we need to aim higher to deliver on the power fantasy that players expect,” said game director Kendall Quinones in a press release. “While we aim to make SHADE Protocol a reality no matter what, your support would go a long way to keeping our creative autonomy and craft the best game we can.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Little Legendary:

About

Discover a world where music, code, and combat collide. Swap between DAWN and SHADE forms to unleash devastating abilities, wield Instruments as weapons, and rewrite reality itself in a world on the brink of annihilation by the SHADE Protocol. The game introduces an interesting mechanic: the Protocols, thanks to them you will be able to encode your own playstyle, combining protocols and specialized code fragments, to alter your attacks, defenses, and abilities, but also recode enemies at your will, changing how they behave to allow you overcome the most dangerous threats.

Seamlessly switch between DAWN and SHADE modes, altering combat styles and gameplay dynamics. Wield Instruments, powerful code-based weaponry inspired by music, each serving a unique role in battle and exploration. Engage in high-speed, skill-based combat, parrying and countering enemies in a world that demands mastery. Explore vast, interconnected Bastions, where every discovery alters the fate of the war between SHADEs and Xaviors, and the all-consuming SHADE Protocol.

Key Features

  • Dynamic Combat System – Mix precision melee combat with specialized Instruments, executing devastating combos, parries, and counters. Swap between DAWN and SHADE modes to adapt to different playstyles in real-time.
  • UNISON System – Rewrite Reality – The world of SHADE Protocol exists as code. Wield it to manipulate events, relive key moments, and choose their ultimate outcome, shaping the fate of entire factions.
  • Unique Defensive Mechanics – Perfectly timed parries and counters restore Echo, a vital energy source for powerful Instrument attacks and defensive maneuvers.
  • Instruments – Weapons That Sing – Wield an arsenal of musical weapons, including the Twilight Spear, Sunrise Great Axe, and Midnight Chakram, each with distinct combat and exploration abilities.

The war is lost. The song is rewritten. Will you take the stage?

SHADE Protocol will be available for PC via Steam. A release date has yet to be announced.

item.title: Colorbound demo now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Test out the colorful puzzle platformer.

A demo for puzzle platformer Colorbound is now available for PC via Steam, publisher Whitethorn Games and developer Panpipe Studio announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Whitethorn Games:

About

Bring the world around you to life with the power of color in Colorbound, a vibrant palette-platformer. Join Anku on a heartfelt journey to reunite his late grandfather’s band by using color to shape the world around you. As you journey, you’ll solve puzzles, uncover secrets, and help a family of musicians come together one last time.

Key Features

  • A Farewell Tour For Your Grandfather – Anku’s grandfather was a beloved musician to his people, but his band has long since scattered. Now, with only memories and a special gift, Anku must journey across diverse landscapes to find the missing musicians, reignite their passions, and give his grandfather the farewell he deserves. Along the way, you’ll use color to brighten the canvas, turning obstacles into opportunities, and puzzles into music!
  • Change Colors to Change The World – In Colorbound, you will collect colors onto your palette which can be used to overcome logic and light platforming puzzles. From lush forests to forgotten cities, Colorbound‘s overworld offers a variety of mind-bending puzzles that span a variety of locations and aesthetics.
  • Finding Balance – Not all colors behave the same way. Some may be lighter, allowing objects to float away once painted, while other colors are heavier and may drop down. Using this to your advantage can help Anku cross the treacherous terrain to reach his destination.
  • Rooted in Culture – Colorbound draws inspiration from the Aymara culture of the Andes, blending traditional music and art styles with an indie-gem-inspired puzzle platformer experience. Informed by Panpipe Studio’s Chilean culture and heritage, Colorbound celebrates the rich culture of South America while delivering a universal story of love, loss, and the power of art.

Colorbound is due out for PC via Steam in 2026.

item.title: Spaceman Memories launches April 15, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Retro-style turn-based RPG dated.

Retro-style turn-based RPG Spaceman Memories will launch for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on April 15, 2026, developer NerdyPunkDev announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

Spaceman Memories is a retro JRPG that takes place in a distant future but draws inspiration from ancient Japanese folktales. A story full of wonder and nostalgia as you take on the role of Ichiro 94, an astronaut who wakes up from hypersleep to go on a journey to find the remnants of his past.

Set in a futuristic Japan overrun by spirits, Spaceman Memories is a true ode to classic JRPGs of the past. The game’s world coupled with its heartwarming narrative, offer players a chance to relive the good old days of 2D gaming. As the spaceman Ichiro 94, whose capsule mysteriously landed back home after a space mission, players embark on a poignant journey of self-discovery, encountering strange creatures, and battling formidable foes, all while uncovering the secrets of his forgotten past and ancient Japanese mysticism. With each step, players must also solve puzzles and use Ichiro’s abilities to fight, all of which are vital in the quest to uncover the truth about his past.

Immerse yourself in a beautifully crafted retro Japanese game, brought to life in a vibrant 3D world brimming with emotion and nostalgia. This heartwarming adventure, seamlessly blends open-world exploration with puzzles and turn based battles offering a truly unforgettable experience!

Key Features

  • Engage in epic, story-driven exploration and masterfully crafted turn-based battles in a classic JRPG experience.
  • Experience a captivating journey through a world inspired by ancient Japanese folklore, brought to life in hand-crafted 3D pixel art.
  • A deep and emotional storyline that explores themes of memory, identity, and the painful realities of loss.
  • A variety of quests and challenging boss battles offering an engaging nostalgic experience
  • Travel through diverse environments ranging from futuristic cities to long-forgotten dungeons to magical forests.
  • An original soundtrack made with nostalgic synths that perfectly capture the game’s retro atmosphere

item.title: Mariachi Legends launches in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

New Metroidvania game from 9 Years of Shadows developer.

Pixel art, combat-oriented, side-scrolling Metroidvania game Mariachi Legends will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2026, developer Halberd Studios announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Mariachi Legends is a brutal, pixel art, combat-oriented Metroidvania set in the heart of Mexico. You play as Pablo Cruz, a detective who has agreed to a deal with Death herself. She has given Pablo the ability to transform into the mighty La Sombra, allowing him to fight back against the criminals encroaching on his hometown. In return, Pablo has vowed to bring Madre Catrina the one thing that has eluded her grasp: the man who defied her power and became immortal.

Versatile and Supernatural Combat

  • Test your reflexes and showcase your unique fighting style as you loot and level up.
  • Perfect your parry skills and enjoy the brutal combat filled with finishers.
  • Find and equip a vast array of weapons and sub-weapons to personalize your fighting style. From guns and swords to whips and magical casts, venturing through the alleys is sure to prove dynamic!
  • Constantly obtain new abilities that will make you even more powerful as the story unfolds.

The Colorful and Rowdy Neighborhood

Welcome to Santa Mascota, a small town known for it’s lively streets, colorful residents and, most recently, a streak of bad luck laced with danger.

Somebody has to bring Santa Mascota’s good fortune back, and you’re best suited given your track-record.

  • Embrace your detective skills to find abandoned corpses, interrogate suspects and ultimately solve the mystery surrounding several deaths in town.
  • Watch as your hometown becomes alive and the townsfolk will open shops, share a drink, and even offer challenging side-quests.

Fortune Favors the Bold

  • Have your fortune told by Madre Catrina at the beginning of the game to determine your unique circumstances and abilities.
  • In the game, look for several Tarot cards during your journey and explore the different sorts of power they can provide. Find them all and become unstoppable.

Adventure Around the Clock

  • Explore a giant dual map that turns familiar paths into renewed challenges.

item.title: Call of Duty won’t release Modern Warfare or Black Ops back to back anymore
item.content:encoded:
Jay Peters

is a senior reporter covering technology, gaming, and more. He joined The Verge in 2019 after nearly two years at Techmeme.

Future Call of Duty releases will no longer include back-to-back launches of Modern Warfare or Black Ops games, Activision announced on Tuesday. The past four releases in the series have been Modern Warfare II (2022), Modern Warfare III (2023), Black Ops 6 (2024), and Black Ops 7 (2025), but moving forward, Activision wants to offer “an absolutely unique experience each and every year,” according to a blog post.

Black Ops 7 came out in November to mixed reviews, and in Europe, the game had a “disappointing launch,” The Game Business reports. Ahead of the game’s release, Treyarch Senior Director of Production Yale Miller told CharlieIntel that he was worried about Black Ops 6 and Black Ops 7 being seen as too similar.

“We will drive innovation that is meaningful, not incremental,” Activision says. “While we aren’t sharing those plans today, we look forward to doing so when the time is right.” The post also notes that “the future of Call of Duty is very strong and we believe our best days are ahead of us given the depth and talent of our development teams” and that the “next era” of Call of Duty will “deliver precisely on what you want along with some surprises that push the Franchise and the genre forward.”

This year, Call of Duty is also facing competition from EA’s Battlefield 6, which sold more than 7 million copies in its first three days of launch and is already being touted by EA as the “best selling shooter game of the year,” and Arc Raiders, which has sold more than 4 million copies.

Tired of predictable presents? Let's liven things up with some classic Nintendo merch. Whether you're on the hunt for the perfect gift for a gamer or just want to add some excitement to your own life, we've got you covered. From a new system equipped to play N64 games on 4K TVs to some of our favorite Nintendo Switch games, we've handpicked the best of the best for 2025. The IGN Deals team was excited to collaborate with some of our NVC folks (shout out to all the Ninfriendos) this week to get their own personal recommendations here, so let's take a look at the latest and greatest gifts for that Nintendo fanatic in your life, in no particular order (except for #1).

1. Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle

Picked by: IGN Deals Team

To nobody's surprise, we have to recommend the Switch 2, especially the Mario Kart World bundle. We gave Mario Kart World an 8 out of 10 in our review, with Logan Plant saying, “Mario Kart World may not make the most convincing case that going open-world was the boost the series needed, but excellent multiplayer racing, incredible polish, and the thrilling new Knockout Tour mode still more than live up to its legacy.”

The Nintendo Switch 2 has been flying off shelves despite a lack of Black Friday deals, and then even more so after retailers finally dropped the price by $50 off and on during Cyber Week. There are more Switch 2 bundles still available that include everything from microSD Express cards to other games. Although this list is technically unordered, this is the clear winner for the best Nintendo gift you can get this year.

Picked by: Peer Schneider

Nintendo launched Switch 2 this year – which brought with it a lot of excitement about the new system, controllers (who doesn’t love magnets!), and games. But it also meant we didn’t get a lot of “crazy toy maker” experiments, like alarm clocks, cardboard backpacks, or micro-sized consoles. Which is why my pick for the perfect Nintendo fan gift this year isn’t exactly something truly new: it’s the Metroid Prime 4 amiibo triple threat of Samus herself, Samus & Vi-O-La, and bounty hunter Sylux. Metallic paint amiibo are often some of the best – and I’m really liking the more aggressive stance of the standalone Samus and her shiny-red new suit and motorbike combo. amiibo Sylux Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Series

The two Metroid amiibo are available now and Sylux is out now (as of December 4).

3. Switch 2 Pro Controller

Picked by: Logan Plant

The Switch 2 Pro Controller might be the best controller Nintendo has ever produced, finally unseating the GameCube controller after more than 20 years on top. Its matte material feels fantastic in the hands (and somehow never gets grimy), the control sticks have a great level of tension, the ZL and ZR triggers fit your fingers perfectly, and the new GL and GR back buttons add extra flexibility to whatever game you’re playing. Plus, it has a headphone jack, which was easily the Switch 1 Pro Controller’s biggest weakness. And, it has fantastic battery life – I’ve only had to charge mine a handful of times since the Switch 2 launched in June. Sure, Switch 1 controllers work on Switch 2, but the hardcore Nintendo fan in your life deserves this massive upgrade.

Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller

4. Alarmo Clock

Picked by: Seth Macy

Alarmo is an absolutely adorable throwback to Nintendo's roots as a toy maker, while also paying homage to its current success as a video game company. Characters of your choosing will watch over you while you sleep, and while that may sound creepy, it's not. Don't answer that question, please. I don't want to know.

Alarmo

Picked by: Logan Plant

Simply put, this is the game to get for Nintendo Switch 2 this holiday season. We called Donkey Kong Bananza a 10/10 masterpiece in our review back in July, praising its destructible environments and incredible movement. It may not star Mario or Link, but this is a top-shelf first-party Nintendo game that got the Switch 2 generation off to a smashing start. It takes between 15 and 20 hours just to reach the credits, with dozens of more hours waiting for anyone that wants to see absolutely every banana tucked inside. If I were a kid, I can’t think of a game I’d have more fun with on Christmas morning than this one.

Donkey Kong Bananza

Picked by: Seth Macy

Ever since this was first announced, there's been a place inside my soul that needed it in my life. If you're the same, or know someone who is, this is probably the coolest, and most affordable, Nintendo-themed LEGO set going. Everything about the LEGO Game Boy is delightful, from the screens you can change out to reflect the game you want to show off, to the replica carts you build with it. It's roughly the same size as an actual Game Boy, too, and the buttons feel almost identical to the ones on the real deal. It only takes around an hour to put together, and then you have this super cool collectible to show off to everyone who asks, and even people who don't ask. Stop people on the street, get their opinion of it. Maybe you'll make a new friend, who knows?

LEGO Game Boy Set

Speaking of Game Boy...

7. Pokémon Legends: Z-A

Picked by: Jacob Kienlen

I’ve been a fan of Pokémon games since I first got my own copy of Pokémon Yellow Version on the Game Boy back in the 90s. I’ve played almost every mainline entry in the series since then, and I was super excited to start playing Pokémon Legends: Z-A when it launched this year.

IGN gave the game a solid 8/10 review, and I agree that it’s a great game overall. It takes bits and pieces of Legends: Arceus and Scarlet and Violet that brought new life to the series and flat out does those things better. The entire story takes place in a single location (Luminose City), which seems so small until the game starts to unfold and you meet new people and unlock new areas. It’s the urban Pokémon game I didn’t know I needed, and I’d recommend it to any fellow Pokéfan looking for their next obsession.

This is the ultimate Nintendo 64. Preorders sold out almost instantly when it was first announced way back, and the first restock has already come and gone. Maybe, just maybe, there'll be another one and you can grab it. Whoever gets one of these will be as happy as the original Nintendo 64 kid from the home video that springs up this time of year on social media.

This isn't an emulator: it's a field-programmable gate array. What does that mean, exactly? Too complicated to get into now, but essentially this IS a Nintendo 64, it's not emulating it. It's an actual piece of futuristic technology that lets you play your N64 games on modern TVs in 4K. If you manage to score an Analogue3D this year, you will be the Hero of the Holidays. Four-player GoldenEye never looked so good.

item.title: Sony Slashes PlayStation VR2 to Black Friday Low, Now Cheaper Than Meta Quest 3S and Perfect for PS5 Owners
item.content:encoded:
Virtual reality transforms gaming from something you watch on a screen into an experience where you’re actually inside the game world, and if you own a PS5, the PlayStation VR2 delivers that immersion better than any other console VR system available. Sony’s second-generation headset offers a massive leap forward from the original PSVR and it packs cutting-edge technology that makes virtual worlds feel tangible and responsive.

Previous holiday seasons saw this headset stubbornly hold its full retail price, but this year brings a welcome change with the VR2 dropping to $299 on Amazon, down from its standard $399 price tag. This matches the Black Friday pricing and marks a record low for hardware that elevates your PS5 gaming experience to another dimension.

See at Amazon

Follows Your Eyes and Responds to Your Touch

Eye tracking technology built right into the headset makes gameplay possible that wasn’t possible before: It lets games show detail where you’re looking while using less processing power in other areas. This foveated rendering method keeps frame rates smooth and visuals clear without making your PS5 send the most detail across the whole field of view at once. Eye tracking not only improves performance, but it also lets you interact with the game in new ways. For example, you can aim weapons, choose menu options, or start events just by looking at them.

The headset feedback system sends physical sensations directly through the unit itself. For example, you can feel the rumble of an explosion, the tension of a bowstring, or the impact of raindrops through vibrations that go along with the sound and picture. The adaptive triggers and haptic feedback in the VR2 Sense controllers work together with these haptic pulses to make a single sensory package where every action has a physical effect. Adaptive triggers change their resistance based on what you’re doing in the game, so pulling back a bowstring or squeezing a trigger feels different from one another. Finger touch detection can tell when your fingers are resting on buttons and when you are actively pressing them.

The 4K HDR screen has 2000 x 2040 pixels per eye which makes the images clear and gets rid of the “screen-door effect” that used to happen with older VR headsets, where you could see individual pixels making a grid pattern. HDR support gives virtual worlds the right amount of contrast and color depth, making bright highlights stand out while keeping details in dark areas. The 110-degree field of view is wide enough to feel natural without causing distortion that some ultra-wide FOV headsets have. It also keeps things clear at the edges of your peripheral vision.

Sony’s Tempest engine makes 3D audio that lets you pinpoint the exact location of footsteps, gunfire, or background noise with amazing accuracy. This adds important spatial awareness that makes the game more immersive and effective. The PS5’s single USB-C connection makes setup much easier than the original PSVR’s cable nest, so you can get into games faster and with less trouble. Inside-out tracking uses cameras in the headset to map your play space without needing any outside sensors.

For $299, the PlayStation VR2 is a great deal because Sony usually keeps first-party hardware at full retail price for years after it comes out: The $100 off makes high-end VR technology more affordable, especially since you’re getting eye tracking, haptic feedback, and 4K HDR visuals that other PC VR setups would charge a lot more to match.

Might & Magic: Clash of Heroes and Superbrothers: Sword & Sworcery EP developer Capybara Games has announced Find Your Words, a short, free adventure game about trying to communicate without speech.

Announced during today's Wholesome Snack presentation, the game doesn't have a release date yet; it's set to arrive on Steam sometime next year, and when it does, it'll be entirely free, although there will be an "optional supporter edition" you can buy if you want to support the studio.

In Find Your Words, Capybara Games is promising "scenic campgrounds brimming with wildlife" in which you'll "build a community one friendship at a time" through several "interactions and activities" with folks currently hanging out at the campground.

Co-creators Vic Nguyen and Jon Maur say that Find Your Words was inspired by raising "non-speaking kids", which is why the game's main character doesn't communicate through speech; instead, they'll use a system of symbols discovered around the game's world to help them speak to others.

Combining symbols in different ways will give them "unique meanings", Capybara Games says, and you'll need to combine those symbols in certain ways in order to get your message across to those who communicate with more conventional methods.

Find Your Words utilizes a form of AAC (alternative and augmentative communication), a system that uses charts, photographs, symbols, and other non-verbal methods to help non-speaking children to communicate. It sounds like a great place to start if you're a total neophyte to AAC (as I am!).

You can check out a trailer for Find Your Words, which showcases the game's Lil Gator Game and To a T-style aesthetic direction, right here.

Find Your Words is due to launch on PC via Steam sometime next year. No versions for other platforms have been announced as yet. Stay tuned for more on this one.

item.title: Cozy MMO Spirit Crossing Lands on PC Next Year
item.content:encoded:
Spry Fox has announced that Spirit Crossing, the cozy MMO previously only available on mobile devices, will be making its PC debut sometime next year.

The mobile version of Spirit Crossing is published by Netflix; the streaming giant acquired Spry Fox back in 2022, but last week, it was revealed that the indie studio's co-founders have bought their company back from Netflix and will operate as an independent entity from now on.

In that spirit, the PC version of Spirit Crossing will be self-published by Spry Fox, but nothing's changing in terms of the mobile version; publishing duties for that will still be handled by Netflix.

If you're not familiar with Spirit Crossing, it's a cozy MMO developed by the folks behind the similarly snuggly Cozy Grove (I mean, the clue's right there in the name).

Described by Spry Fox as a game about "the joy of shared experiences, creative expression, and connection with friends", Spirit Crossing takes place in a "vast, beautiful world with ever-changing environments".

Upon starting the game, you'll be assigned to a Waystation, a smaller community-within-the-community, and together with your fellow Waystation members, you'll "collectively build, decorate, and fortify" your little patch of cozy ground.

Don't worry, though; there's no PvP play in Spirit Crossing, although you can travel to other players' Waystations and engage in "co-op activities such as harvesting, dancing, and mural painting" if you want.

Rather uniquely for the cozy MMO space, Spirit Crossing employs what Spry Fox calls a "friendship progression system", through which you'll gradually unlock features like proximity chat, two-player emotes, and gift-giving, plus more.

You'll be able to check out Spirit Crossing when it launches on PC via Steam sometime next year. If you're a Netflix member, then you can also enjoy it on Android and iOS right now at no extra cost.

item.title: Anker Solix 2000W Power Station Goes Super Low on Amazon, Winter Blackout Season Just Got Less Scary
item.content:encoded:
Anker made a name for itself by making reliable chargers and power banks. Now, though, the company has moved into portable power stations that are strong enough to compete with well-known brands like EcoFlow and Jackery. The Solix C1000 (gen 2) can provide 2,000W of continuous power and 3,000W of peak power which is more than the first generation model (which could only provide 1,800W).

The original version is now $436 instead of its usual $799, but the Gen 2 is actually cheaper at $371 instead of $549 which makes it the better deal even though it has more power. The Solix C1000 Gen 2 is the best portable power stations you can buy on Amazon right now and no other competitor offers a better price-to-wattage ratio.

See at Amazon

Power Output That Can Handle Real Appliances in the Home

The 2,000-watt continuous output means you can run big appliances that cheaper power stations can’t handle, like full-size refrigerators, microwave ovens, power tools, and space heaters. The 3,000-watt surge capacity kicks in when devices need more power to start up: This is important because many motors and compressors use a lot more power in those first few seconds than they do when they’re running normally. This extra space makes sure that your refrigerator doesn’t trip the station when the compressor turns on and that your circular saw doesn’t stop working when you hit a knot in the wood.

The LiFePO4 battery has 1,024 watt-hours of energy, which is enough to keep a normal refrigerator running for 12 to 15 hours during a power outage or power a laptop for several full workdays when you’re off-grid.

LiFePO4 battery chemistry has a lot of advantages over the lithium-ion cells found in cheaper batteries. For example, they last longer and can be charged more times before their capacity starts to drop. These batteries also work better in extreme temperatures than regular lithium-ion batteries as they can keep working in the cold when other power stations would fail. Anker says this battery can be charged more than 3,000 times before its capacity drops to 80% which means you could use it regularly for years before you notice any significant wear and tear.

The ability to charge quickly in 49 minutes sounds too good to be true, but you’ll see how much it changes the game when you use it. Plugging the Solix C1000 into a wall outlet during lunch will charge it all the way up before you go outside to work or camp for the afternoon. This quick recharge means that you don’t have to charge it overnight like older portable power stations did which makes it much more useful for last-minute trips or emergencies when you need power right away. Solar charging makes the station even more flexible, but you’ll have to buy solar panels separately because they don’t come with the unit.

There are a lot of ways to connect to different devices. For example, there are AC outlets for regular household appliances, USB-C ports for laptops and phones, USB-A ports for older devices, and a 12V car outlet for car accessories. The LCD screen shows the current power draw, the percentage of battery life left, and the estimated runtime based on how you’re using it right now. This lets you make smart decisions about how much power you use.

When you think about what you’re actually getting for $371, a portable power station is a great deal. The original Solix C1000 was a good deal at $436, but the Gen 2 is even better because it costs less and has more power – and this is one of those rare times when the newer model costs less than the older one.

item.title: Call of Duty Will no Longer Have Back-to-Back Releases of the Same Sub-Franchise
item.content:encoded:
Activision has announced that moving forward, it will no longer have back-to-back releases of Call of Duty’s subfranchises like Modern Warfare and Black Ops.

The news came as part of a new update from Activision, which acknowledged that the franchise has recently failed to meet some players’ expectations. The admission comes following what has been described to Insider Gaming from sources as a “rough launch” for Black Ops 7.

“We also know that for some of you, the Franchise has not met your expectations fully. To be very clear, we know what you expect and rest assured we will deliver, and overdeliver, on those expectations as we move forward,” the blog post read.

Will Call of Duty Stop Being Annual?

Despite Activision’s admission and realisation that Call of Duty has failed to meet some players’ expectations, they have pretty much said that annual releases will continue moving forward, which will provide fans with an “absolutely unique experience each and every year.”

It’s said that those plans will not be shared today but will be “when the time is right.”

The blog post concludes with the following message,

“To be clear, the future of Call of Duty is very strong and we believe our best days are ahead of us given the depth and talent of our development teams. We have been building the next era of Call of Duty, and it will deliver precisely on what you want along with some surprises that push the Franchise and the genre forward. We look forward to welcoming you in, listening to you, and moving forward together. “

item.title: Magic: The Gathering Reveals 38 Marvel Super Hero Cards Including Hulk, Doctor Doom, And Cap
item.content:encoded:
Magic: The Gathering‘s Marvel Super Heroes set arrives next June, just in time for Avengers to return to theaters and Doomsday to debut at the end of the year. But the licensed Universes Beyond expansions have been at their best when they add more flavor to the trading card game rather than just lean on it for publicity. On Tuesday, Wizards of the Coast gave fans a taste of what to expect from the latest comic-book-inspired set, from Incredible Hulk card art to new Captain America card mechanics.

The company teased 38 new cards on its latest WeeklyMTG show. There’s plenty of Legendary Creatures, some neat spells, and lots of really nifty art. There’s Captain America, a 3/2 white creature with a shield counter that protects it from one instance of damage. There’s Bruce Banner, a 1/1 blue who can transform into the Hulk with an Enrage condition that gives him a +1/+1 counter when damaged and a second attack phase.

And then there’s Doctor Doom, a 3/3 black creature that enters with Doombot tokens, lets players draw a card and take damage at the end of their turn, and is indestructible while an artifact creature or Plan is on the field. Wizards also revealed a notable reprint of Heroic Intervention, with the effect of “Permanents you control gain hexproof and indestructible until end of turn.” The set has a Horn of Greed, too, with the perfect Doctor Doom “toot” art.

While the reprints each have callbacks to some classic Marvel comic book art, my favorite-looking cards so far are the full-art variants of Widow-Making Infiltrator, Dig Through Time, and Elektra, Deadly Assassin. And for all your Saga nerds out there, we have World War Hulk, which ends with doubling a creature’s power and toughness and giving it trample, and The Coming of Galactus, which culminates in a 16/16 black Elder Alien with flying, trample, and “Whenever Galactus attacks, destroy target land.”

I wasn’t too impressed with the Marvel set when it was initially revealed earlier this year. Coming right after Spider-Man and in the midst of a glut of other Universes Beyond crossovers, it seemed likely to be another property stretched thin and rushed out to keep the release calendar rolling. These initial card reveals look promising, though. I’m intrigued. Maybe I wasn’t as burnt out on Marvel as I thought. I might just have to chase Galactus after all.

item.title: AirPods Pro 3 Return to Black Friday Record Low on Amazon, Apple Store Still Charges Full Price
item.content:encoded:
Apple never puts its newest products on sale, especially not something as new as the AirPods Pro 3 which came out just a few months ago. But Amazon has taken matters into its own hands and cut prices on almost all of Apple’s products right before Christmas. For instance, you can get these third-generation AirPods Pro for $219 instead of the usual $249 which is the same price as the lowest price we saw on Black Friday. You might be tempted to buy the older AirPods Pro 2 because they are cheaper, but this newer model has so many more features powered by Apple Intelligence that if you don’t upgrade, you’ll miss out on features that change the way you use wireless earbuds.

See at Amazon

Efficient Noise Cancellation

Apple says that the AirPods Pro 3 block out twice as much unwanted noise as the already-great Pro 2 model – and it means that subway rumble, airplane engine drone, and coffee shop chatter almost completely disappear. The active noise cancellation changes in real time based on the shape of your ear canal and the fit of the ear tips and keeps changing to keep out as much outside noise as possible. The box now comes with five different ear tip sizes instead of the three it used to have to make sure you can find a snug fit that makes the best seal for the best noise cancellation and bass response.

The audio architecture was completely changed to focus on what Apple calls “three-dimensional sound,” which makes music feel like it’s happening around you instead of inside your head. Bass hits with more depth and power without drowning out the midrange, and high frequencies give you clear detail that lets you hear each instrument in a complicated arrangement. The vocals are very clear and present, putting the singers right in front of you in the soundstage. When you turn your head, spatial audio with dynamic head tracking keeps sound sources anchored to your iPhone or iPad which makes for an immersive experience that is especially fun when watching movies or playing games.

One of the most useful new features of the AirPods Pro 3 is heart rate sensing: It turns your earbuds into workout partners that can track your heart rate and calorie burn for 50 different types of exercise. This information syncs with the Activity app on your iPhone, adding to your Move ring and step count. It also gives you useful information through the new Workout Buddy feature powered by Apple Intelligence.

Live Translation uses Apple Intelligence to process speech and give instant translations that sound natural: This breaks down language barriers in real-time conversations. Think about going to another country and being able to talk to people there without having to pull out your phone or look for a translation app: The feature works with many languages and gets better as Apple Intelligence learns from more interactions. Active Hearing Protection keeps an eye on the noise levels in your environment all the time and it lowers the volume when you’re around sounds that could hurt your ears, like construction work, concerts, or loud traffic.

The Hearing Aid feature uses the great fit and noise processing to work as a clinical-grade hearing aid, complete with automatic Conversation Boost to boost speech frequencies. You can even use your iPhone and AirPods Pro 3 to take a hearing test at home which will give you personalized audio profiles that make listening to music, calls, and media more enjoyable. With active noise cancellation turned on, the battery lasts for eight hours and with Transparency mode and hearing aid functionality turned on, the battery lasts for up to ten hours.

It might not sound like much, but Apple products don’t usually go on sale this soon after they come out, so this price is very good by Apple’s standards. You can get flagship earbuds at a lower price before the holiday shopping season ends because Amazon matched the Black Friday record low in mid-December. You’re buying earbuds that work as fitness trackers, hearing aids, translation devices, and high-end audio equipment all in one package which makes the price worth it even before the discount is taken into account.

Tailored Realities is a 448-page collection featuring 10 novellas and short stories. Though Sanderson is largely known as a fantasy author, Tailored Realities skews more toward science fiction. The biggest story is Moment Zero, a brand-new novel of roughly 200 pages. This apocalyptic sci-fi story follows two police officers who, while investigating a disappearance, find themselves in an alternate dimension filled with zombies and vampires.

Moment Zero is one of two alternate-reality sci-fi novellas included in Tailored Realities. The collection also features Snapshot, a 2017 sci-fi thriller starring two detectives who investigate a murder from within a dangerous virtual reconstruction of the past. Snapshot's original hardcover edition was 128 pages.

The third novella in Tailored Realities is Perfect State. Originally published in 2015, Perfect State follows a god-like ruler's first date with a goddess-like ruler of a different world. The highly rated novella is roughly 90 pages.

None of the stories take place in Sanderson's Cosmere--the shared universe of The Stormlight Archive and Mistborn--but two shorter novellas are connected to his popular YA franchises. Defending Elysium is a prequel to Sanderson's science fiction series Skyward. Mitosis is a side story that takes place between the first and second books in the superhero-action series The Reckoners.

The novellas are joined by five short stories, including "Firstborn" and "Dreamer," which follows deceased gamers who take control of living humans to play high stakes games.
